title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing one or more contacts (if a contact is chosen on the Overview, this contact is the default selection for the report)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing one or more groups

title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing #All, when the chosen report is created for all portfolios in the system

title: Report generation parameters
body: Date

title: Report generation parameters
body: The Report date or Date period (see also Selecting dates). Depending on the nature of the report and the data shown on the report, you need to either select a single date, a date range or no date at all. For example, reports showing positions or allocation naturally show data for a single date, whereas reports showing transactions or a history of figures naturally react to a date range.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Note that if you combine individual reports or create report package, the report date (or the end date of the period) is the same for all reports. If you enter different dates or date ranges, the system picks up the last one you entered and applies it to all reports. To have individual reports generated for different dates, you should save them as different packages and then combine as a report package.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Purchase value)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Original purchase price and Transaction purchase price. The selection tells whether the reports always show the transaction purchase price, or whether the reports show the original purchase price of transactions that original transaction information is defined to. The default selection of the purchase price used can be set in Preferences - Transactions.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Securities)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Security, if you want to create a report based on only one security

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Grouping)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Grouping of your report's content from alternatives Security type, Security, Class 1 - 5, Country, Market place, Currency, Counter, Issuer, Asset class or Asset type (available for older reports), or from alternatives Portfolio, All portfolios, Portfolio type, Portfolio's country, Portfolio's juridical form, Portfolio's contact, Security, Position, Linked security, Type, Subtype, Basetype, Class 1 - 5, Country, Currency, Marketplace, Settlementplace, Tag, Issuer, Asset class, Asset type, Assets and liabilities and Assets and accounts by category.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Allocation group)

title: Report generation parameters
body: If you have selected a grouping that involves asset classes or asset types, select also the allocation group (defined in Preferences) you want to use.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Transaction types)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Transaction types to be printed out on the created report from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Transaction types. You can choose multiple transaction types from the list by holding the Ctrl key and choosing the needed transaction types.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Reference, Counter)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Reference or counter.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Tags)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Transaction tags to limit the transactions included in the report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Security type)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Security types to be printed out on the created report from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Security types. You can choose multiple security types from the list by holding the Ctrl key and choosing the needed security types.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Language

title: Report generation parameters
body: language of the report: Customer/Portfolio language, Svenska, Suomi or English. The languages available are defined in Preferences - Language. The default selection is the Language of portfolio/customer, when the language of the report will be the language set for the portfolio in the Basic info of the Portfolio window. In order to being able to print reports in different languages, you would need to define appropriate translations for security types, transaction types, etc. thorough Preferences - General - Internationalization.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Print reports even if empty)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Print out report(s) even if they would be empty, e.g. the report has no content. If checked, report will always be printed out, even if it has no content. If not checked, when creating only one report, the report is not opened if it is empty, and when creating multiple reports (either per portfolio or per customer), empty reports are not created into the specified folder.

title: Report generation parameters
body: File format

title: Report generation parameters
body: File format of the report to be created: PDF, XLS, XLSX, CSV, TXT, DOCX, PPTX, RTF, XML, XHTML.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Output type

title: Report generation parameters
body: Output type of the report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: One report - Prints out one combined report for the selection of the Customer, Group, Portfolio selection, if possible. The generated report ones up on the screen after the report generation is finished.

title: Report generation parameters
body: One report (background) - Similar to the One report option, but the report is run in the background (a good choice when generating large reports or reports requiring heavy calculations - when the report is run in the background, the FA Portfolio can be used while the report is generating). The report can be found in the Generated reports tab.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer or Report per portfolio - Prints out a report (or combination of reports is multiple reports are chosen) for each customer or each portfolio chosen in Customer, Group, Portfolio. The individual reports can be found in the Generated reports tab.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer via email or Report per portfolio via email - See sending reports via email for more details.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer to documents, Report per portfolio to documents or Report per trade order to documents - See publishing reports to documents for more details.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer (list emails below) - Report is sent to a list of email addresses you provide instead of emails linked to the contact.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per portfolio (list emails below) - Report is sent to a list of email addresses you provide instead of emails linked to the portfolio.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Emails (comma-separated))

title: Report generation parameters
body: List of customer email addresses (comma-separated) to which the report is sent. The report is sent to these emails instead of emails linked to the contact or portfolio. If you don't define any emails, the report is generated but not sent. If some emails have errors, you can see an error in the Email(s) column of the report summary (see Status report from report generation).

title: Report generation parameters
body: The field is visible only if you chose the output type Report per customer (list emails below) or Report per portfolio (list emails below).

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Folder name)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Name for the folder for the created reports. All characters except for special charaters, such as "+", "%", "*", and so on, are allowed. The reports are saved to a folder with the defined name, and can be downloaded from the Generated reports tab. Folder name you define here is extended with a time stamp when the folder was created (following the syntax Folder-yyyyMMdd-hhmmss), ensuring that even if you use the same folder name, reports within one generation always go to a unique folder (available from FA 3.11 onward).

title: Report generation parameters
body: The field is visible only if you chose the output type other than One report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Email template)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Select the email template you want to use. This field is visible only if the output type is Report via email, and it pre-fills the template used when sending reports via email.(Available from FA 3.11 onward).

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Transaction tags)

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Available if you run reports from the Transactions view). Single select transaction tags to assign to the transactions after they are reported, for example, "Reporting - Confirmation sent". You can use this option to filter out reported transactions in the Transactions view and exclude them from future reports.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Trade order tags)

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Available if you run reports from the Trade orders view). Single select trade order tags to assign to the trade orders after they are reported, for example, "Reporting - Confirmation sent". You can use this option to filter out reported trade orders in the Trade orders view and exclude them from future reports.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Available in FA Advisor

title: Report generation parameters
body: Option to make the generated reports available to download in FA Advisor.

title: Report generation parameters
body: You can generate reports and combined report packages to download in FA Advisor by ticking the Available in FA Advisor checkbox.

title: Report generation parameters
body: After filling in the report parameters, you can click the Generate report button. Depending on your selections, the report is downloaded to your computer or saved in a folder and you can view it in the Generated reports tab. Note that if you selected Reports via email as the output type, you need to fill in the fields for email reporting in the new window that opens.

title: Report generation parameters
body: The combination of the selected group, customer and portfolio together with the selected output type allows you to efficiently create different kinds of reports. For example, selecting a group in the group, customer and portfolio field and defining the output type to be either report per portfolio or report per customer generates separate reports per each portfolio/customer within the group. You don't need to create the same report for each portfolio/customer separately, but you can generate these at once and fetch the individual reports from the Generated reports tab after the reports have been created. Additionally, if selecting a group in the group, customer and portfolio field and defining the output type to be one report, you get one aggregated report of the contents of the portfolios within the group.

title: Combined report
body: You can combine multiple different reports for the same date in a single PDF file. Individual reports are placed on separate pages within the file.

title: Combined report
body: To generate a combined report, multi-select reports from the report list in the order you want them to appear in your combined report - the order is also indicated at the bottom of the Report window.

title: Report packages
body: You can save your combined report and the report generation parameters for later use as a report package. You can make the report package visible only to yourself or choose to share the report package with other FA users.

title: Report packages
body: To save selected reports as a report package:

title: Report packages
body: Open the report window and multi-select reports as a combined report. Essentially, saving a report package means saving a combined report for later use.

title: Report packages
body: Define the report generation parameters on the right. Note that you can only select one date range or date for all the reports included in the package.

title: Report packages
body: Once you are happy with the content and order of your combined report, click Save as a new report package.

title: Report packages
body: Define a name for your report package - this name will be used in the file name of the generated report (define the report file naming syntax in Reporting Preferences), and to list the report in the report package listing.

title: Report packages
body: Decide which users you want to share the report package with, i.e. which users can see and use the report package in the Report window:

title: Report packages
body: Not shared – The package is saved only for you to use.

title: Report packages
body: Shared with everyone – The package is available for everyone to use.

title: Report packages
body: Shared with group xx – The package is available for the users in a specific user group. The list of groups includes user roles assigned in the FA Admin Console app (for details, see User details pane).

title: Report packages
body: Shared with role xx – The package is available for the users with a user role defined on the system level.

title: Report packages
body: To use a saved report package:

title: Report packages
body: Open the Report window.

title: Report packages
body: The Report window opened from the Portfolios and Contacts views, and from the New → New report menu features all report packages you created before.

title: Report packages
body: The Report window opened from the Transactions or Trade orders view features only report packages that include at least one transaction or trade order report.

title: Report packages
body: Select the report package at the bottom of the Report window. You can see the reports within the package in the combined report section, and the report generation parameters are shown on the right.

title: Report packages
body: If your selected report package contains a report that is no longer available (the report has been uninstalled after you have saved your report package), you'll get a confirmation to generate the report package anyway without the unavailable report(s).

title: Report packages
body: If needed, edit the report generation parameters on the right.

title: Report packages
body: Click Generate report.

title: Report packages
body: To delete a report package, select it from the list and click the trash can icon . This will not delete the reports within the package, but just remove the report package from the list. To modify your report package, make changes in the selected reports or the parameters and click Update report package.

title: Report packages
body: If you have a report package selected, you can't select reports since the report listing shows you the content of your report package - Unselect the report package to use the Report window manually again.

title: Generated reports
body: The Generated reports tab shows the generated reports. The reports are visible on the tab sheet when multiple reports or reports on background are generated: one report created opens up on directly, but multiple reports are stored on the server, where they can be downloaded to be viewed on your computer.

title: Generated reports
body: The reports are saved in folders, which are named based on the information given on the previous tab sheet. The folders can be seen at the top of the window, in the Folders area: you can download a folder to your computer, or you can view the reports saved inside this folder by clicking it from the folder listing. The reports within the chosen folder appear at the bottom of the window, in the Reports area.

title: Generated reports
body: The following functions are available through right-clicking the folder or report

title: Generated reports
body: Open

title: Generated reports
body: Opens and downloads the chosen folder as a zip package or an individual report (a folder or report can also be opened by double-clicking it).

title: Generated reports
body: Delete

title: Generated reports
body: Deletes the chosen folder or individual report.

title: Generated reports
body: The following buttons are available:

title: Generated reports
body: Delete reports

title: Generated reports
body: Deletes the chosen folder with all the reports in it.

title: Generated reports
body: Download reports (ZIP) (WIN)

title: Generated reports
body: Downloads the chosen folder as a zip folder, if there are multiple reports in the folder, or as a single file, if the folder only includes a single report. Use this button when you are using Windows operating system / Windows computer.

title: Generated reports
body: Download reports (ZIP) (OS)

title: Generated reports
body: Downloads the chosen folder as a zip folder, if there are multiple reports in the folder, or as a single file, if the folder only includes a single report. Use this button when you are using OS operating system / Mac computer.

title: Generated reports
body: Download reports (PDF)

title: Generated reports
body: Downloads all the reports in the chosen folder as one pdf file.

title: Status report from report generation
body: Whenever the system generates reports in the background and saves them under the Generated reports tab, the system produces a status report out of the generation. The status report is saved along with the report files into the same folder under the Generated reports tab - you can find it among the report files with the name Report_summary.csv. (Available from FA 3.11 onward)

title: Status report from report generation
body: The status report provides you with details on which reports were generated successfully and which reports failed, allowing you to more easily follow up and get a grasp of the status of your reporting. In addition to the success or failure of each report, the status report includes relevant information on which group, customer or portfolio the report was generated to, for which dates and with what file type. In addition, if you were sending reports via email, the email address the report was sent to is included in the status report. This allows you to easily replicate a generation, for example if a couple of reports failed to be generated while most of your reports were generated successfully.

title: Ongoing generations
body: The Ongoing generations tab sheet shows the ongoing report generations: if the report generation includes multiple reports, the progress of the generation is shown on this tab sheet. The report generation can also be cancelled on this tab sheet.

title: Log tab
body: The Log tab sheet shows the report generations performed and the history of email reporting: the tab sheet shows the date and time, when a report was created, as well as a description of the report generating activity.

title: Log tab
body: The following buttons are available:

title: Log tab
body: Clear

title: Log tab
body: Clears the log listing

title: Log tab
body: Refresh

title: Log tab
body: Refreshes the listing to show the latest actions.

title: Scheduled report generations
body: Scheduled report generations tab lists all the report packages that have been scheduled to be generated automatically by the system. The tab lists all report packages with a schedule defined for them (ordered by next upcoming generation), shows each packages' next scheduled generation, and allows you to remove or edit any given schedule directly through the tab. (Available from FA 3.11 onward)

title: Related links
body: Reporting in FA User guide

title: Yield curves view
body: The Yield curves view allows you to view the observations of a yield curve defined in the Yield curve Preferences.

title: Yield curves view
body: Yield curve is a curve showing several interest rates across different times - yield is actually only known with certainty for a few specific maturity dates, while the other maturities are calculated by interpolation. The Yield curves view allows you to identify these points the yield is know for on a specific date. Select a yield curve you want to view, and you can see the values for different dates for the different tenors (i.e. different maturities) associated with your curve. The values are picked up from the market data entires of the securities associated with the selected yield curve with different tenors.

title: Yield curves view
body: You can also export the results as an XLS file.

title: Analytics+
body: Analytics+ allows you to easily analyze your portfolios, providing you with an extensive set of analytical key figures to analyze your investments.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Setting up analysis

title: Setting up analysis
body: Choose if you need to analyze portfolios (Groups, contacts, portfolios tab) or securities (Securities tab).

title: Setting up analysis
body: For portfolios, analysis parameters are:

title: Setting up analysis
body: Group, customer or portfolio you want to analyze.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Grouping for your analysis. You can group your analysis with:

title: Setting up analysis
body: Portfolios.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Security-related parameters, such as asset classes and types, security type, classifications, countries, marketplace, currencies, issuer or issuer group.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Pre-defined combinations, such as Asset type and portfolio, Security type and subtype, Portfolio and sub portfolio, or Portfolio and asset type.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Custom grouping, when you can freely select the grouping levels from the available alternatives. If you want to include the actual position level in your analysis, select "Security", "Position" or "Positions by customer" as the last grouping option.

title: Setting up analysis
body: When grouping with asset type selection, you are also required to select which allocation group is used in grouping your analysis.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Date range for your analysis.

title: Setting up analysis
body: For securities, analysis parameters are:

title: Setting up analysis
body: Security you want to analyze (you can select multiple securities).

title: Setting up analysis
body: Date range for your analysis.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Benchmark index chosen from the general benchmarks defined in Preferences. To learn more, see Preference - Portfolios.

title: Setting up analysis
body: When you choose the parameters, the Analyze button turns black to indicate you changed your criteria and should update your analysis.

title: Setting up analysis
body: Analytics+ also allows you to save your frequently used analysis and different sets of selected columns for later use.

title: Results of the analysis
body: Based on your selected parameters, the analysis is presented as a table with analytical key figures accompanied with a return graph and allocation pie chart. Remember that your analysis (or the analytical key figures) can be exported as an Excel or PDF file, and the graphs at the bottom can be printed out or downloaded as a PDF or image files.

title: Table with analytical key figures
body: The table at the top allows you to select your desired columns from a wide range of different analytical figures. All the analytical figures are available for the selected time period and fixed time periods of 1, 3, 6, 9, 12 months and year-to-date (YTD). See below for a comprehensive list of available analytical figures.

title: Table with analytical key figures
body: You can also hide positions through right-clicking the table, allowing you to easily and effectively view the analysis only on the group level. Whether the positions are hidden or shown is remembered for your user name.

title: Return graph and allocation pie chart
body: The graphs at the bottom visualize the overall performance for the selected time period, show the purchase value compare to market value, allowing you to track how your portfolios’ value has developed, and draws the current date's allocation for the selected portfolio(s).

title: Return graph and allocation pie chart
body: You can easily re-draw the performance and allocation graphs for different visualizations:

title: Return graph and allocation pie chart
body: Select one of the pre-define time intervals to zoom in to the chart, or drag an area of the chart with your mouse you want to zoom in to.

title: Return graph and allocation pie chart
body: Select an individual position or group (i.e. an individual row) from the table to re-draw the return graph for the selected position or group.

title: Return graph and allocation pie chart
body: Select multiple positions or groups to re-draw the return graph for comparison.

title: Return graph and allocation pie chart
body: Click a point in the return graph to re-draw the allocation pie to show the selected day's allocation.

title: Export time series of data
body: Analytics+ provides you with tools to export time series of underlying data from Analytics+. This provides you with means to figure out how different figures are calculated in Analytics+ and how the underlying data has changed over time. You can also use the exported time series to further enrich your data, for example to apply further calculations in a spreadsheet or turn the time series into diagrams. (Available from FA 3.9 onward)

title: Export time series of data
body: Right-click your selection in Analytics+ and choose to Export time series of all underlying data as XLSX or Export time series of TWR-related data as XLSX. Exports contain:

title: Export time series of data
body: Time series of the selected data based on your selected date range, each day’s values on its own row.

title: Export time series of data
body: All underlying data available in Analytics+ or TWR-related data with relevant formulas for you to track how TWR was calculated each day.

title: Export time series of data
body: Each time series on its on sheet in the Excel, if you multi-selected rows before taking the export.

title: Export time series of data
body: The time series export does not export the columns you have selected in Analytics+ nor the values shown in Analytics+ columns - the time series export exports the time series of the underlying "raw" data that Analytics+ uses to calculate the figures it shows, such as TWR % for a specific time period.

title: Export time series of data
body: You can flexibly export different data sets through selecting different levels in your analysis. You can export data for individual positions, for any available group level (e.g. “Stocks” or “Funds”), or for total “Investments”. Select different portfolios or groups to aggregate data, different groupings to gain new levels to export data from, and different time periods to control the length of your time series.

title: Figures available in Analytics
body: The tables below list the main measurements and formulas available in Analytics+. In addition to the below described measures, different time periods (1, 3, 6, 12 months and year-to-date (YTD)) are available for certain key ratios. In addition, you can select Code and Name.

title: Figures available in Analytics
body: Logarithmic (natural) returns are used as a input in most of the calculations.

title: Figures available in Analytics
body: New columns are added into Analytics+ in each version - if you are running an older version of FA, you might not have all the below columns available. Refer to the Release notes for when new values are introduced.

title: Risk-adjusted performance measures
body: Risk-adjusted measures listed below makes it easier to compare different assets, portfolios and securities. Different to basic performance measures, these measures take also into consideration the riskiness of the investment.

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Certain key ratios are available also for benchmark (identified with "Bm" at the end of the column name).

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: There is a specific logic to determine which benchmark is used in which scenario:

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Portfolio's benchmark (if it exists) is always used on the portfolio level, when:

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: investments are grouped by portfolio

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: the analysis is taken on a single portfolio

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: If portfolio has a benchmark that a) is composed of one or many instruments (usually indices) and b) instrument is linked to a sector that is used in the grouping of the analysis => that instrument is used as a benchmark for the sector

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Otherwise, if the sector has a default benchmark defined in Preferences - Asset classes and types => that benchmark is used as a benchmark for the sector

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Benchmark aggregation is also supported up or down the grouping selected for the analysis with the following conditions:

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Benchmarks are aggregated up if the parent does not have its own benchmark (e.g. sector benchmarks are summed up with weighted daily average of TWR Bm to the parent group and sub-portfolio benchmarks are summed up to the main portfolio if sub-portfolios are included in the grouping). If the parent portfolio has content, it will be considered one of the child portfolios in analytics+ when using "Portfolio and subportfolio" grouping. Therefore, the aggregation logic works only if the parent portfolio is empty.

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Aggregated values never replace actual values (e.g. sector benchmarks or sub-portfolio benchmarks are not aggregated to portfolio, if the portfolio has its own benchmark).

title: Measures of benchmarks
body: Benchmarks are aggregated down as well (e.g. sector benchmark is used in instruments under the sector benchmarks). However, this does not apply to the portfolio benchmark. only to sector benchmarks.

title: Top menu
body: The top menu is a toolbar at the top of the page. It allows you to access many functionalities of the FA system using the drop-down menus on the left or the icons on the right side of the toolbar.

title: New
body: The New menu allows you to manually create something new into the system.

title: New
body: New report generates a new report from the Report window.

title: New
body: New contact creates a new contact in the Contact window.

title: New
body: New portfolio creates a new portfolio in the Portfolio window.

title: New
body: New security creates a new security in the Security window.

title: New
body: New transaction creates a new transaction in the Transaction window (choose the security type of the transaction from the menu - the available security types are listed in the order defined in Preferences - Security types).

title: New
body: New trade order creates a new trade order in the Trade order window (choose the security type of the trade order from the menu - the available security types are listed in the order defined in Preferences - Security types).

title: New
body: New corporate action creates a new corporate action in the Corporate action window.

title: New
body: New contract creates a new contract in the Contract window.

title: Tools
body: The Tools menu allows you to launch various kinds of standard and custom processes. The processes include:

title: Tools
body: Administering the FA system.

title: Tools
body: Creating coupons and expirations, paydowns, and securities from outside sources.

title: Tools
body: Launching fee calculations and monitoring processes.

title: Tools
body: Importing files and sending documents.

title: Tools
body: Creating contacts.

title: Tools
body: Realizing profits and losses on FX contracts.

title: Tools
body: Synchronizing the FA system.

title: Update
body: The Update menu allows you to recalculate portfolio report data outside the schedule set in Preference for a selected portfolio or all portfolios. Actions within the Update menu are logged (see FA audit logs in FA Admin Console).

title: Update
body: For more information about portfolio report recalculation, see Report data calculation in FA Admin guide.

title: Import
body: The Import menu allows you to import data into the FA system by uploading files from your computer. For more information about importing and the import formats, see Importing.

title: Menu icons
body: The following options are available at the top right of the menu:

title: Menu icons
body: Click to select the language of the user interface (English, Finnish, or Swedish). The language selection only affects the user interface for your user and is remembered the next time you log in. You can also change the default language of the user interface for all users (see Preference - Administration).

title: Menu icons
body: Click to access the FA Documentation site.

title: Menu icons
body: Click to view what version of FA Back you are currently running and see the highlights of the latest major version released. Your current version number is in the title of the window that opens.

title: Menu icons
body: Click to log out of the FA system.

title: Add a column based on a key figure
body: You can add custom columns based on key figures into the different search views and Analytics+. To learn how to do this, follow the instructions below.

title: Add a column based on a key figure
body: If the key figure you want to add as an Analytics+ column isn't already in the system, configure it in Preference first. To learn how to add key figures, see Add key figures in FA User guide.

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: You can add key figure values for contacts, portfolios, or securities by entering them manually in the respective windows or by importing them.

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: To add key figure values manually in FA Back, do the following:

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: Open the Key figures tab in the Contact, Portfolio, or Security window.

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: On the left side of the tab, select the key figure and click Add new value.

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: Define the date and value.

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: Click Add.

title: Step 1 - Fill in key figure values
body: For more information about importing key figures, see File formats for importing securities and security prices and FA Invest in FA Back reference.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: To configure a key figure as an Analytics+ column, do the following:

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Open Preference → Content and translations → Analytics+ columns.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Click Add new column and fill in the fields:

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select how you want to define the column - Select "Based on a security key figure".

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Code* - A unique code for the column. You can't change the code after saving.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Name* - Name for the column.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Description - Optional description of the column content, shown when selecting columns in Analytics+.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Link - Optional link for more information about the column, shown when selecting columns in Analytics+.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select the security key figure you want to use as a column - Choose the key figure to link to the column from the dropdown list.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select how to calculate values on group levels -

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Do you want to override the default formatting? Choose if you want to specify a custom formatting for the column. If you select "Yes, override formatting", you also need to specify the format.

title: Step 2 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Click Save.

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: This rule removes the "LEI code missing" portfolio tag and unlocks the contact's portfolios if the contact has LEI code entered in the Contact window, MiFiR tab.

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: Condition: LEI code is available in the contact

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: Actions: The "LEI code missing" tag is removed from the portfolios where the contact is the primary contact, and the portfolios are unlocked.

title: Add a task type to FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor has a set of standard task types (calls, emails, letters, and meetings) you can work with, but you can also create your own task types. The following instructions describe how to create a task type in FA Developer and make it available to users in FA Advisor.

title: Step 1 - Create a form
body: Create a new form by following the instructions in Create a form. Note down the Form ID, because it is needed in the next step.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: After creating a form for the task type, you need to create a process:

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Go to Workflows → Process modeler and click Create process.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Fill in the fields for the new task type and click Create new model.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Model name. Enter a name for the task type to be displayed in FA Advisor.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Model key. Give an identifier for the task type.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: In the process editor, create a process with at least a start event, an activity (for example, user task), and an end event. To learn more about creating user tasks, see Create a contact.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click on the activity you created and enter the Form ID from the previous step in the Form key field.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Form key. Enter the Form ID from the previous section.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Category. Enter "FAADVISOR".

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Name. Enter the task type name.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Assignments. Choose which users the task can be assigned to by clicking the field and selecting "Fixed values". In the Candidate groups field, specify user groups by user role and separate groups with a comma (see Manage access to a workflow).

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click on the space outside the process and then on Target namespace. Enter "FAADVISOR" in the field.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click Save.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: The task type can now be included in the FA Advisor app to make it available to users.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: The final step of adding a task type is to make it available in FA Advisor:

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Go to Workflows → Process modeler → Apps and click on FA Advisor.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Open the App editor in the top right and then click Edit included models.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Select your task type to include it and click Close.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Click Save the app definition in the top left and tick the Publish? checkbox.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Click Save and close editor.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Your task type is now available in FA Advisor and can be assigned to users.

title: Create a form
body: To create a form in FA Developer app, do the following:

title: Create a form
body: Go to Workflows → Forms and click Add form in the top right.

title: Create a form
body: Add components from the list on the left and define the component properties.

title: Create a form
body: Add a Label in the Display tab to distinguish the component from others. This field is required for some components.

title: Create a form
body: Specify the Property Name in the API tab to identify the field in the collected data for the component (see Define form components to import data in FA).

title: Create a form
body: For the Content component, enclose the text in HTML tags. Form translations only work for text inside HTML tags.

title: Create a form
body: Define the form name and save the form.

title: Create a form
body: After saving the form, you can see it in the Forms view. You can now use the form in a process: see Display a form.

title: Related links
body: Workflows

title: React to changes in FA data
body: You can integrate the FA Platform with your external system to receive messages about and react to changes in FA data.

title: Receive messages about core data type changes
body: You can receive messages when contacts, portfolios, securities, transactions, or trade orders are inserted, modified, or deleted in FA. The messages are sent to a service bus topic called “data-changes” and are available for up to 7 days. The messages only indicate the data type, the action (create, update, or delete), and the object ID.

title: Receive messages about core data type changes
body: You can use this functionality for synchronization, for example, by implementing API calls to fetch the updated information that your external sysem uses. To start using this functionality, contact FA.

title: Receive messages about core data type changes
body: The following are example messages:

title: Define custom integrations to service bus topics
body: FA Developer allows you to gain value from the messages you receive about data changes when you define custom integrations to the service bus topics. The following is an example Camel route that prints the content of messages arriving in the “data-changes” topic:

title: Define custom integrations to service bus topics
body:
<route id="custom-data-changes-listener">
   <from uri="amqp:topic:data-changes/subscriptions/customlistener"/>
   <log message="Received message: ${body}"/>
</route>

title: Define custom integrations to service bus topics
body: In this example, the messages are simply recorded in connector microservice system logs. To synchronize FA Platform data with your external system, you can use Apache Camel (for example, REST API) to send the message content to your external system.

title: View funds and share classes
body: The NAV status view shows your funds and their key information, NAV status and dates, and outstanding trade orders in a table.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: View funds and share classes for a specific fund group by selecting it in the Select a fund group dropdown. The dropdown shows fund groups that have a code with the prefix "FAFUNDS_" (see Create fund groups in FA Back reference). You can set a fund group as the default selection by saving the view (see Adjust the view).

title: Viewing options
body: Refresh the table content by clicking at the top right.

title: Viewing options
body: Export the funds table as an XLSX or CSV file.

title: Viewing options
body: For the whole table, click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: Viewing options
body: For specific funds, select rows and click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view).

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: View fund details
body: To view the fund details, click the fund to open the Fund details sidepane. You can see:

title: View fund details
body: Basic info: fund ID and fund currency.

title: View fund details
body: NAV information: NAV status, next NAV date, who and when calculated and accepted the current NAV. If the NAV acceptance is in progress, you can view the details by clicking View progress.

title: View fund details
body: Orders: outstanding trade orders per share class affecting the next NAV calculation.

title: View fund details
body: For details about the fields, see Fund and share class information.

title: View fund details
body: You can also open the fund portfolio in FA Back by clicking View in FA Back .

title: View share class details
body: To view share class details, expand a fund with the arrow next to it and click on a share class. The Share class details sidepane opens, showing the following information:

title: View share class details
body: Basic info: share class security information (Code, ISIN code, Currency), NAV data (Latest NAV as well as the NAV overview graph) and high-water mark information (if applicable).

title: View share class details
body: Orders: outstanding trade orders for the share class affecting the next NAV calculation.

title: View share class details
body: For details about the fields, see Fund and share class information.

title: View share class details
body: You can also open the share class security in FA Back by clicking View in FA Back .

title: Fund and share class information
body: ID

title: Fund and share class information
body: Portfolio ID for funds and Security code for share classes.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Status

title: Fund and share class information
body: NAV calculation status that indicates if you should calculate NAV for the fund today. Learn more about the statuses in the Workflows and NAV statuses section. NAV statuses are shown for the current date and time, displayed above the funds table. If the date and time aren’t current, refresh the page by clicking the refresh icon at the top-right corner to view the recent information.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Error

title: Fund and share class information
body: Errors in NAV calculation and acceptance. If there are any errors, you can see the icon next to the fund status. To view the errors, hover the mouse over the icon. To find out the error details, go to the audit log in the Fund details pane on the right.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Next NAV

title: Fund and share class information
body: The date for which you should calculate and accept NAV next. NAV date may differ from the calculation date – the date when you should do the calculation.

title: Fund and share class information
body: For example, you might calculate NAV for the last day of the month (for example, 31.1) on the first day of the next month (for example, 1.2). When you log in on 1.2 your fund status would be “pending NAV”, but the next NAV date would show 31.1.

title: Fund and share class information
body: The date switches to the next one in the schedule as soon as you accept the calculated NAV.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Latest NAV

title: Fund and share class information
body: The latest date for which you calculated and accepted NAV. You can see the corresponding NAV values on the share class level in the table.

title: Fund and share class information

title: Fund and share class information

title: Fund and share class information
body: Order count, Total count

title: Fund and share class information
body: The number of outstanding trade orders on the fund level and for each share class. The number is based on the trade orders marked as executable in FA Back. To learn more about entering trade orders for the fund, see FA Back.

title: Fund and share class information
body: Order value, Total value

title: Fund and share class information
body: The value of outstanding trade orders. The calculation depends on how the trade order was entered in FA Back:

title: Fund and share class information
body: If the trade orders are based on the trade amount, Order value shows total net value. It is shown on the share class level and on the fund level, if all fund share classes are in the same currency.

title: Fund and share class information
body: If the trade orders are based on the number of units, Order value shows total number estimated with latest NAV: Order_value=Number_of_units⋅Latest_NAVOrder_value=Number_of_units\cdotLatest_NAV

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: To calculate dividends and create dividend transactions in the shareholder portfolios, follow the steps:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Open the Dividends view.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Click Add dividend in the top-right corner of the view and fill in the fields:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Fund

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The fund that pays the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Share class

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The share class that pays the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Declaration date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The date when the dividend payment is announced.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Ex-date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The dividend ex-date. The dividend is calculated based on the number of share class units in the shareholder's portfolio on the morning of the ex-date (the position after the previous day's transactions). This date will become the transaction date of the created dividend transaction. When you calculate NAV on the ex-date, the dividend isn't anymore included in NAV.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Payment date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The payment date of the dividend, when the dividend is actually paid to the shareholder. Payment date becomes the settlement date of the created dividend transaction.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Dividend per unit

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The dividend to pay per share class unit.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Transaction type

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Transaction type to use for the dividend transactions. By default, FA Fund Management uses the Fund dividend (FMDIV) transaction type.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Memo

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Memo note for the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: If the dividend execution date is today, proceed to executing the dividend by clicking Save and execute.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Alternatively, save the dividend and execute it later (click Execute in the Dividends view).

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Check the tax rates and FX rate in the Dividend view that opens. Click Execute to generate dividend transactions. The dividend status changes to "Executing", and then to "Executed" in the Dividends view. You can view the dividend transactions by double-clicking the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: As a result, FA Fund management does the following:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Creates dividend transactions in the shareholder portfolios.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Creates a cashout transaction (FMDWD type) to take out the dividend amount from the fund portfolio. Next time you calculate NAV, the total dividend amount is excluded from the calculation.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: You can ensure that all shareholders received dividends by clicking Reconcile in the Dividends view. The system shows a confirmation message that reads "Dividend transactions are created for all shareholders".

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: You can edit an unexecuted dividend by doing the following:

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: For the dividend you want to modify, click the icon and select Edit.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Make your changes in the side pane that opens.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: If you want to proceed to executing the dividend, click Save and execute and fill in the tax rates and FX rate. If you want to execute the dividend later, click Save.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: You can cancel dividend transactions for executed dividends, for example, if you notice that some tax rates are incorrect or if the error is due to incorrect positions in shareholder portfolios. To cancel dividend transactions, do the following:

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Double-click an executed dividend in the table.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Select the dividend transactions to delete and click the  icon.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: If needed, make corrections in the shareholders' portfolios.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Click Reconcile next to the dividend in the Dividends view and confirm that you want to execute missing transactions (Execute).

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Enter the correct dividend parameters (you can only correct tax or exchange rates that are not used in any transactions) and click Execute.

title: Set up a management fee
body: Example: The yearly management fee is 0,1%. The fund's previous NAV is 365 000 EUR. The used day count convention is "ACT/ACT ISDA" and the selected holiday calendar is "Saturday/Sunday weekends". The calculated fee is 365 000 EUR * 0,1% / 365 days * 1 day = 1 EUR. If we change the holiday calendar to "No holidays/weekends", the fee is calculated for all three days and amounts to 3 EUR.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: The next step is to include the fee in your fund's fee structure. You can apply the management fee on the fund or on the share class level. Fund-level fees are applied to all share classes. They are calculated first, in the order you place them in the fund settings, followed by the share class fees.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: To define the fee parameters:

title: Add the fee to the fee structure

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: Set the fee capitalization account for the fund in the Basic info tab. Enable Set as fee capitalization account for the cash account you want to use for fee capitalization. You can only set one account for fee capitalization per fund. If you do not set a fee capitalization account, the system uses the account you marked as the default account in the Basic info tab.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: (Optional) If you want to use a separate schedule for calculating fees ( see Ongoing fees for details), set it up in the Schedules tab.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: Define the fee crystallization schedule in the Schedules tab. For details about schedule settings, see Create a fund.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: Add the management fee on the fund or share class level. Open the Fee structure tab in the fund or share class settings, add the fee formula, percentage and other parameters (for details about fee parameters, see Create a fund and Add share classes).

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: When the fee calculation and capitalization has been set up in FA Fund Management, accrued fee transactions are created every time you calculate NAV. When it is time for capitalization, go to FA Back and create transactions to withdraw the fees from the fund cash account and deposit them to the fund fee account. Follow the instructions in Handle accrued fees and capitalization in FA User guide.

title: Set up a performance fee
body: A performance fee is calculated based on the fund return. For each day in the calculation period, the NAV increase is compared to a threshold (benchmark, hurdle rate, or index), and the difference is multiplied by the fee percentage. The daily fees are summed to get the total amount.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: Performance fee with equalization ensures that every shareholder pays the same percentage of performance fee no matter when they subscribed to the fund.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For the fee equalization, the fund subscriptions are executed with NAV excluding the performance fee. To equalize the performance fee in the future, FA Fund Management creates compensation trade orders for buying or selling fund units. The trade order type depends on the current share class NAV (without performance fee) compared to the high-water mark (HWM) - the highest NAV value in the share class:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: If NAV (without performance fee) is smaller than HWM, a trade order with Equalization debit (EQDE) transaction type is created.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: If NAV (without performance fee) is greater than HWM, a trade order with Equalization credit (EQCR) transaction type is created.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: The trade amount is calculated as subscription amount * performance fee per unit.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: On the crystallization date, when you accept NAV:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: HWM is updated to the NAV value if the current NAV is higher than HWM.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: The compensation trade orders are executed.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: To set up the performance fee with equalization, you need to specify the schedule for the fund and enter the fee details on the share class level:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the fund settings:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the fund settings, Schedules tab, set the fee crystallization schedule. For a newly created fund, the first fee date in the schedule must be the same as the fund inception date you entered in the Basic info tab. If you transfer an existing fund into FA Fund management app, make sure that the first fee date is the crystallization date.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the Fee structure tab, select Calculate performance equalization fee with contingent redemption method. The "Performance fee with crystallization" formula is used to equalize the performance fee on the crystallization date.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For details and field descriptions, see Create a fund.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the share class settings, specify the fee properties in the Fee structure tab, Performance fee equalization section.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For details and field descriptions, see Add share classes).

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: FA Fund management app accrues the performance fee every time you calculate and accept NAV. On the crystallization date, when you calculate and accept NAV, FA Fund management calculates performance fee and creates compensation trade orders. You can view the fee amount in the NAV window.

title: Track changes and view history
body: FA Operations tracks the changes made by the users and stores the history of reconciliations and reconciliation items.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Audit logs show who and when made changes to a reconciliation or a reconciliation item. You can see the old and new value of the property that was changed.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Reconciliation history shows closed reconciliations and items.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a reconciliation, open the reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview or History view and click Audit log at the upper right.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a specific reconciliation item, open it in the Reconciliation overview or History view and go to the Audit log section.

title: Reconciliation history
body: Reconciliation history

title: Reconciliation history
body: To access all reconciliations that have been uploaded in FA Operations and view the reconciliation items, open the History view.

title: View reconciliations
body: The Reconciliations tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliations in the system. You can:

title: View reconciliations
body: Download the reconciliations list in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View reconciliations
body: View reconciliation details and the list of reconciled items (click in the reconciliation row). To download the reconciliation report, then click Download report in the upper-right corner. If the reconciliation is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation.

title: View reconciliations
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: View all reconciliation items
body: The Reconciliation items tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliation items that have been uploaded in the system. You can:

title: View all reconciliation items
body: Download the list of all items in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View all reconciliation items
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.
