title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks and onboarding new customers. You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: Work with customers

title: About FA Advisor
body: Maintain up-to-date customer information. You can view your customers, or all customers in the system, and select an individual customer to view and edit their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Add customer-related notes and store documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related tasks: calls, emails, letters, meetings, or custom tasks that you define.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer investments

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a summary of a customer's investments or see more details in FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Trade for the customer via FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Keep track of unsigned trade orders that the customer needs to accept.

title: User access
body: Users of FA Advisor need the correct rights to access the app and its functionalities such as trading on behalf of customers.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: To access FA Advisor, a user needs the correct rights in FA Admin Console. To provide a user access to FA Advisor, do the following:

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: Ensure the FA Advisor application is enabled. Contact FA if you need to enable it.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the ROLE_USER right within the FA Advisor role (see Access to FA functionality in FA Admin guide).

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: If limited visibility is in use, it also applies to FA Advisor and the user can see the same customers as in FA Back (see Access for employees in FA Admin guide).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of customers in FA Advisor, a user needs to have the rights to impersonate customers in FA Client Portal. To provide a user the rights, do the following:

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure the user has access to FA Advisor (see Access to FA Advisor).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the following rights (see Access to FA functionality in FA Admin guide):

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL_IMPERSONATE within the FA Back role.

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: ROLE_IMPERSONATE within the FA Client Portal role.

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: The user can now access a customer's investments via FA Client Portal and trade on their behalf. A banner at the top of the view shows what the user has the rights to do with green checkmarks (buy, sell, switch, deposit, withdraw, and cancel orders).

title: Work with customers
body: FA Advisor enables you to access customer profiles in the FA Platform to work with your customers. Customer profiles are created in FA Back as contacts, and FA Advisor allows you to maintain up-to-date information about a customer as well as manage tasks, documents, and notes related to them.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view allows you to view customer information in a table. To open a specific customer's details, click  in the Actions column. To access a customer's investments or trade on their behalf, click  in the Actions column to open the FA Client Portal app.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Use the Customer groups dropdown to view different groups of customers. View customers you are linked to as a representative by selecting "My customers" (default selection), all customers in the system by selecting "All customers", or customers linked to a specific representative by selecting their name.

title: Viewing options
body: Export customers as a CSV or XLSX file by clicking Export.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter the view name. If you used the search fields at the top and want to save them, make sure the checkbox Save current search criteria is ticked.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: You can see the following information as columns in the Customers view or fields in the Customer details:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer’s address information.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Advisors

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's advisors (contacts with contact type 2 in FA Back). You can edit contact definitions under contact type 2 in FA Back (Preference → Contacts → Contact types).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Cash

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of cash in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. Customer ID can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Date of birth

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's date of birth.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in the FA Platform.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity format of the customer, for example passport. Identity can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Investments

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of investments, excluding cash, in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language of reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality of the customer. Nationality can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Order status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trade order status. If the customer has unsigned trade orders, the column shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represented by

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons who represent the customer and the tags specified for them in the customer profile. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can add representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represents

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons the customer represents and optional tags assigned to them. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status of the customer record in the system (active, passive, or closed). Customer status can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country of the customer. Taxation country can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Total assets

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Combined amount of cash and investments in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Transaction no. level

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Level at which the system generates transaction numbers. This is either the portfolio level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within the portfolio, or the contact level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within all of the contact's portfolios. Transaction no. level can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Add notes and documents
body: The Notes and history section at the bottom of Customer details view allows you to add your customer-related notes, store documents like agreements or investment plans, maintain meeting notes about customer meetings, and view completed tasks related to the customer. If the customer has a contact memo in FA Back, you can see it in FA Advisor.

title: Add notes and documents
body: To display notes in FA Advisor correctly, we recommend you use, for example, Google Chrome or Safari as your browser.

title: Manage notes
body: You can add notes related to the customer in the Customer info tab or add new tabs. Notes are also shown in FA Back Contact window, Documents tab. If you delete a note in FA Back, it is also deleted from FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: The FA Back note tab shows the contact memo from the Contact window in FA Back, if you previously used it to store information about the customers. You can't edit or delete the memo directly in FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: To add a new tab with a note, do the following:

title: Manage notes
body: Click + Add tab and enter a name for the note.

title: Manage notes
body: Add note content in the text editor.

title: Manage notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The Meeting notes tab allows you to add notes about meetings and link them to specific dates. Meeting notes are also shown in FA Back Contact window, Documents tab. If you delete a meeting note in FA Back, it is also deleted from FA Advisor.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: To add a meeting note, do the following:

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Click Add meeting note. Create a blank note or select a template (templates are uploaded in FA Back, see Administering documents in FA Admin guide).

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Enter a name and date for the note and add content in the text editor.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: You can download a meeting note as a TXT file by clicking Download or print the note as a PDF by clicking the icon.

title: Store documents
body: In the Documents tab, you can see documents uploaded for the customer. You can track the signing status and check the FA Client Portal availability of each document. To add documents, do the following:

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload and add the documents.

title: Store documents
body: Fill in the fields: Category, Signing status, Show in FA Client Portal. See the field descriptions below.

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: The document is uploaded. To edit the category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal for an uploaded document, click in the Actions column.

title: Store documents
body: For each document, you can see the following information:

title: Store documents
body: Category

title: Store documents
body: Document category, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document categories are defined as tags under "Document type" in FA Back (Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Store documents
body: Document name

title: Store documents
body: The file name. The supported file types are: PDF, DOC, DOCX, ODT, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, ODP, ODS, TXT, CSV, XML, PNG, JPG, RTF, and MP3.

title: Store documents
body: Uploaded by

title: Store documents
body: The user ID of the user who uploaded the document.

title: Store documents
body: Upload date

title: Store documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: Store documents
body: Signing status

title: Store documents
body: Document signing status: canceled, done, error, expired, pending or waiting. These document signing statuses are included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise statuses are defined in FA Back in Preference → Tags → Document tags under "Document signing". Documents are sent for signing in FA Back (see Document signing in User guide).

title: Store documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: Store documents
body: Document availability to customer in FA Client Portal, indicated with a checkmark. You can make a document available when uploading by ticking the Show in FA Client Portal checkbox. In FA Back, documents that are available in FA Client Portal are assigned the tag "Online" (included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise the tag is defined in Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Manage tasks
body: Tasks allow you to plan and record your actions when communicating with a customer. You can schedule calls, emails, letters, and meetings and make notes related to them. You can create other task types in the FA Developer app (see Add a task type to FA Advisor in FA Developer guide). When a task is done, you can mark it as completed. The following sections describe how you can add tasks, search for tasks, and mark tasks as completed.

title: Add a task
body: You can add a new task related to a customer by doing the following:

title: Add a task
body: In the Customer details, Open tasks section, click Add task and select the task type (call, email or letter, meeting). Alternatively, you can click Add task in the Tasks view and select the customer the task is related to after choosing the task type.

title: Add a task
body: Fill in the task information. You can also mark the task as completed.

title: Add a task
body: Click Save.

title: Work on tasks
body: When working with a customer, you can see open tasks related to them by going to the Customer details and viewing the Open tasks section. To view and manage all tasks assigned to you or any other user, go to the Tasks view. The Tasks view allows you to do the following:

title: Work on tasks
body: Search for tasks based on assignee, task type, and task status.

title: Work on tasks
body: View only tasks assigned to you by selecting "Assigned to me" in the Assignee filter.

title: Work on tasks
body: View and manage the task information by clicking in the Actions column.

title: Work on tasks
body: In the side pane that opens, you can change the task status by editing the Due date (future due date gives the task "Open" status, while past due date gives the task "Overdue" status) or by marking the task as complete.

title: Task information
body: The following information is available for tasks:

title: Task information
body: Assignee

title: Task information
body: The user the task is assigned to.

title: Task information
body: Customer

title: Task information
body: The name of the customer.

title: Task information
body: Creator

title: Task information
body: The user who created the task.

title: Task information
body: Due date

title: Task information
body: The date by which the task needs to be completed.

title: Task information
body: Note

title: Task information
body: Notes about the task.

title: Task information
body: Status

title: Task information
body: Task status ("Open", "Overdue", or "Completed"). The "Overdue" status is applied to tasks with a due date in the past. The "Completed" status is applied to tasks marked as complete.

title: Task information
body: Task type

title: Task information
body: Type of action. Standard task types are call, email or letter, and meeting.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: After finishing a task, you can mark it as completed by doing the following:

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click the icon in the Actions column of a task to open the side pane.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Tick the checkbox Mark task as completed.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click Save.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: The task status changes to "Completed". You can view completed tasks for a customer in the Customer details view, Notes and history section.

title: Manage customer's investments
body: You can view a summary of customer investments in FA Advisor. You can also create trade orders on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. Trade orders are sent for execution after the customer signs them.

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details, you can view a summary of a customer's investments in the Investments section. You can view the investment summary for the customer's active portfolios in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: As a table by clicking . The table shows the portfolio name, ID, currency, and in the portfolio currency the value (existing holdings and executed amount) of securities, cash accounts, and market value. The portfolios are in alphabetical order by default, but you can sort the columns in ascending or descending order.

title: View customer's investments
body: As a pie chart by clicking , but only if the customer's portfolios are all in the same currency. The pie chart shows the name, ID, and total value of active portfolios. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are grouped together. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios in the same currency, the pie chart displays 9 portfolios and the remaining portfolios are grouped together.

title: View customer's investments
body: You can also access the customer's investments via FA Client Portal in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details view, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right.

title: View customer's investments
body: Open the Customers view and click the icon in the Actions column.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can buy, sell, or switch securities and make deposits and withdrawals on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. When making trade orders on behalf of the customer, you can also send them to be signed by the customer before execution.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can only trade via FA Client Portal with portfolios in the group "ADV_TRADING" and securities in groups that start with "ADV_.". The groups are assigned in FA Back (see Security groups and Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of a customer, do the following:

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: In the Customers view, click the icon in the Actions column. Alternatively, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right of the Customer details. The customer's FA Client Portal opens.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure you have the rights to trade in the banner at the top of the view (see User access). Allowed actions have a green check mark next to them.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make the trade order, deposit, or withdrawal. For information on how to make trade orders, deposits, and withdrawals, see FA Client Portal documentation.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: The trade order you created is tagged with "Advisor" in FA Back and has the pending signing status until the customer signs it. The customer's Status column in the Customers view now shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: Cancel a trade order
body: You can cancel trade orders in the customer's FA Client Portal app. For details on how to cancel trade orders, see Orders view in FA Client Portal.

title: View pending trade orders
body: If a customer has pending trade orders waiting for acceptance, you can see an indicator in the following places:

title: View pending trade orders
body: Customers view, Status column: Shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: View pending trade orders
body: Customer details: Shows a bell icon next to the customer's name at the top of the view. Hovering your mouse over the bell icon shows the unsigned trade orders from the oldest to the newest.

title: View pending trade orders
body: You can use these indicators to keep track of customers who need to be contacted, for example.

title: Enable features for users
body: You can enable or restrict various features for the user in FA Client Portal. The following sections explain the process of enabling and restricting features for users in FA Client Portal.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: You can hide subportfolios from the user in FA Client Portal. Hidden subportfolios are removed from the portfolio selector, but all figures are still aggregated into the parent portfolio. For more information on portfolio summaries in FA Client Portal, see Overview.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: To hide subportfolios from the Client Portal, assign the "Client Portal: Hide sub portfolio" tag to the subportfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Make documents available
body: You can provide access to the uploaded documents or documents available on the Internet by linking them:

title: Make documents available
body: To make documents available in FA Client Portal, upload them in FA Back and save them with the "Online" tag. To make documents related to specific securities available to the FA Client Portal user, upload them in the Security window, Documents tab, and add the "Online" tag to them. The documents are then listed below the prospectus and KID in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security prospectus available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security KID available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL 2 field).

title: Make documents available
body: For more information on documents in FA Client Portal, see Documents view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: If you want to allow the user to trade in FA Client Portal, you need to enable trading on the portfolio and security level and specify the trading method:

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading for a portfolio, add the "Client Portal: Trade" tag to it in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trading in FA Client Portal, see Trading view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable buying and selling for a security, add the "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). The user can only trade securities with this tag. For more information on buying and selling in FA Client Portal, see Holdings view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable the user to switch a fund position to another fund, add the "Tradeable" and "Switchable" tags to the security in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). For more information on switching fund position in FA Client Portal, see Holdings view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading in units and trade amount, add the "Trade type: Buy units, Sell units, Buy trade amount, Sell trade amount" tags to a security in FA Back (Security window, Basic info tab).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: You can define which securities the user can trade per portfolio. For example, you can allow buying, selling, or switching only certain security types for a certain portfolio. To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities only, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Create a security group with the group code prefix "CP" in FA Back. For example, you can create a group for equities with the code "CP_ EQUITY". For details on how to create security groups, see Groups view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Link the security group to the user's portfolio in Portfolio window, Security groups tab in FA Back (see Portfolio windowt).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Add the "Tradeable" tag to all securities in the group in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: You can restrict access to actions like trading, depositing, and withdrawing based on a mandate between a specific contact and portfolio. This is useful if there are multiple individuals associated with a single portfolio who have distinct roles or permissions based on legal mandates or agreements. For example, you can set individual permissions for Portfolio A so that Person 1 is only able to buy and sell while Person 2 is only able to make withdrawals.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Access is provided by assigning "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio or Contact window. FA Client Portal checks the assigned tags and enables or disables actions for users based on them. You can provide access to trading on the following levels:

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Portfolio level: Provide access to trading for all users associated with a portfolio by assigning it "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio window, Basic info tab (the portfolio is included in a dynamic group).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Contact level (all portfolios): Provide a specific contact access to trading in all portfolios of another contact. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is contact B's representative. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contact window, Representatives tab. Contact A is the only user who gets access to the actions you assigned across all of B's portfolios.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Individual portfolio level: Provide a specific contact access to trading in an individual portfolio. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is linked to a specific portfolio in the Portfolio window, Contact tab or Asset managers tab, meaning they have access to the portfolio in FA Client Portal. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contacts or Asset managers tab. The actions you assigned are only activated for that specific portfolio and contact A.

title: Enable canceling trade orders
body: To enable the user to cancel trade orders with Open or Accepted status, add the "Client portal: Cancel orders" tag to the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trade orders in FA Client Portal, see Orders view.

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: To set up deposits and withdrawals for the user, do the following:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Add the "Client portal: Deposit" and "Client portal: Withdraw" tags to the user's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Mark portfolio accounts to use for deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal. To do this, open the Portfolio window, Accounts tab in FA Back, and set the following properties for the accounts:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Portfolio cash accounts: set the account category to "Internal".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to deposit funds from: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to withdraw funds to: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: If you define multiple external accounts in the user's portfolio, FA Client Portal shows the Deposit from and Withdraw to fields in the Deposit and Withdrawal windows, where the user can choose the external account to use. For more information on deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal, see Deposits and withdrawals.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly investments for the user:

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Add the "Client portal: Monthly investments" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly savings for the user, add the "Client portal: Monthly savings" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: The user can only set up investment or savings plans for portfolios with the required tag. For more information on monthly investments and monthly savings in FA Client Portal, see Monthly investments in FA Client Portal and Monthly savings in FA Client Portal.

title: Accounting settings
body: To start generating bookkeeping postings, you need to set up bookkeeping accounts and posting rules in Preference → Bookkeeping. If you want to generate deferral transactions, you need to set them up separately in the Tools menu.

title: Set up bookkeeping
body: To set up bookkeeping, you need to define bookkeeping accounts and posting rules and then link them to your portfolios. The following sections describe this process.

title: Step 1 - Define bookkeeping accounts
body: To set up bookkeeping, you need to define what accounts the system should use. If your bookkeeping accounts are based on the IFRS Chart of Accounts, we recommend you use the standard bookkeeping accounts included in FA Standard Solution (see Standard bookkeeping accounts). You can also define bookkeeping accounts according to your needs in Preference:

title: Step 1 - Define bookkeeping accounts
body: Go to Preference → Bookkeeping → Account set and click Add.

title: Step 1 - Define bookkeeping accounts
body: Fill in the account set code and name and the account name and number (for more information about the fields, see Account set in FA Back reference).

title: Step 1 - Define bookkeeping accounts
body: Click Save.

title: Step 2 - Define posting rules
body: When bookkeeping accounts are defined, you need to define how the system should generate bookkeeping postings. This is done with posting rules which are defined as sets similar to bookkeeping accounts. Each posting rule describes what transactions (when linked to a security with certain characteristics) are recorded as debit or credit to a bookkeeping account.

title: Step 2 - Define posting rules
body: FA Standard Solution offers some standard sets of posting rules (see Standard bookkeeping rules). You can use these standard posting rules as they are or create new posting rules to fit your needs in Preference:

title: Step 2 - Define posting rules
body: Go to Preference → Bookkeeping → Posting rule and click Add posting rule.

title: Step 2 - Define posting rules
body: Define the posting rule set name and code and select the account set you created in the previous step as the Account set.

title: Step 2 - Define posting rules
body: Create a posting rule by clicking Add, and then fill in the fields or use the Import button to import posting rules (see Preference - Bookkeeping in FA Back reference).

title: Step 2 - Define posting rules
body: Click Save.

title: Step 3 - Link posting rules to your portfolios
body: After defining posting rules, you need to link them to the portfolios you want to include in bookkeeping. The system reports portfolio transactions according to your posting rules after you link the portfolio to them:

title: Step 3 - Link posting rules to your portfolios
body: Open the Portfolio window, Basic info tab of the portfolio you want to use in bookkeeping.

title: Step 3 - Link posting rules to your portfolios
body: In the Posting rule field, select the names of posting rule sets you want to apply to the portfolio.

title: Step 3 - Link posting rules to your portfolios
body: Click Save & close.

title: Step 4 - Use posting-based bookkeeping
body: After you complete the previous steps, you can start using posting-based bookkeeping (contact FA to enable it). In posting-based bookkeeping, the FA system evaluates transactions that you save in a portfolio based on the linked posting rule set and generates individual postings for the transactions to represent bookkeeping entries. You can view the postings in Overview, Bookkeeping tab, the Bookkeeping view, or in the "Bookkeeping postings" report.

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: I changed my bookkeeping rules, but the postings aren't correct in all the transactions. How can I fix it?

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: If you change your bookkeeping rules, you need to generate postings for these transactions. You can mass-generate postings in transaction view: choose the portfolio (and transactions) and click Generate postings.

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: I modified deposit transaction to currency account, but the new purchase price isn't correct in withdrawal postings. How can I fix it?

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: If you modify deposit / withdrawal transactions in history and have already done for example withdrawal transaction linked to modified deposit, the withdrawal postings are not modified. You need to generate new postings to the withdrawal. T do this, save the transactions or filter these transactions in transaction view and click Generate postings.

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: I can't get the purchase price bookkeeping posting correctly from buy transaction. In some cases the value is correct, sometimes not.

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: If you would like to get the buy transaction total price to be posting from buy transactions, you should not use the “Purchase price“ selection in bookkeeping rule, instead use the total price. It is the total price for the transaction.

title: Questions about setting up bookkeeping
body: Note! Check the - checkbox for the accrued interest, if you do not want it to be included to this amount.

title: Standard bookkeeping accounts
body: This sample chart of accounts is based on IFRS Chart of Accounts. This is available as an optional package in Standard Solution.

title: Standard bookkeeping rules
body: The accounting rules in the Standard Solution allow for quick implementation / demoing of the function. You can use the rules as they are, or (as in many cases) make the rules to suit your bookkeeping needs.

title: Standard bookkeeping rules
body: Gains and losses on sales (sell transaction) is done like in FRS: The gain or loss on the sale of investments measured through profit or loss should be the difference between the time of sale and the end of the previous month.

title: Standard bookkeeping rules
body: Changes in the fair value of investments measured through profit or loss should be obtained as monthly changes. These value changes can be recorded with FA’s deferral function. The deferral helper tool creates “Value adjustment” transactions. These transactions will modify bookkeeping values of open purchase lots. For more information, see Run deferrals.

title: Define posting rules for currency account profit and loss
body: If you have security transactions with settlements towards foreign currency accounts, you need a separate posting rule to capture the profit and loss on the account. Define the posting rule in Preference → Bookkeeping → Posting rule as <Transaction type> + CURRENCY (security base type). Example: Buy + CURRENCY.

title: Define posting rules for currency account profit and loss
body: You need to define posting rules for all transaction types involved in security transactions that can have settlements to foreign currency accounts. Typically, the following transaction types are affected:

title: Define rules for FX contracts
body: Posting rules for FX contracts are complicated, but the following sections show examples of how you can define them. Note that the accounts in these examples may not be relevant for your chart of accounts and accounting principles. You only need to generate postings against dummy accounts if your accounting software expects each transaction to net to zero. This is because in FA, the two legs of the contract are treated as two separate transactions.

title: Create your own importer
body: You can import transactions, trade orders, and market prices in external files such as files you receive from a counterparty. To do this, you need to configure the reader format so that the FA system can read the external file, and the following sections describe this process. To create a transaction importer, we recommend using the sample XML configuration. You can copy it from this page (see Quickstart: Use sample reader configuration for transaction import) and paste it into FA Back in step 1.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Define the basic information of the importer:

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Go to Preference → Importing → Reader format configuration and click Add.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: In the Basic info tab, fill in the fields:

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Name

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: The importer name (shown in the Import window when you upload the file).

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Read from line

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: A number that defines how many header rows the importer skips. Define 1 if the importer should read all rows. If your file contains a header row, define 2 to skip it.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Separator

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: The column separator, typically a comma or a semicolon.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Date format

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Date format used in the external file, for example, dd.MM.yyyy.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Decimal point

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: The decimal point in the external file.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Importer type

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: The type of information the external file contains: transactions, trade orders, or market prices.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: Click Next.

title: Step 1 - Define the basic info
body: The Format mapping tab appears.

title: Step 2 - Map and include columns
body: In the Format mapping tab, you need to select columns one by one on the left, map their values between the external file and the FA system, and add the columns to the list on the right. Before you include a column in the list on the right, you need to define its Format type based on if the format and values in your external file match the FA system (see External file column format and values match FA and External file column format or values don't match FA).

title: Step 2 - Map and include columns
body: You need to include at least all required columns in the importer:

title: Step 2 - Map and include columns
body: For transactions, see the required fields in FA Format for importing transactions in FA Back reference.

title: Step 2 - Map and include columns
body: For trade orders, see the required fields in FA Format for importing trade orders in FA Back reference.

title: Step 2 - Map and include columns
body: For market prices, the required fields are "Security update code", "Market date", and "Close price" (for field descriptions, see FA Format for importing security prices).

title: Step 2 - Map and include columns
body: If a column is not required by the FA file format, you can use Skip column to have the importer skip it. Skipping a column creates an empty field.

title: External file column format and values match FA
body: If the format and values of the column in the external file are the same as in the FA system, the default format type can be used. For example, in the FA system, the transaction type column "type" is a string with values such as "B" (buy) and "S" (sell). If both the format and values of the column in your external file match the FA format and values, use the default format type:

title: External file column format and values match FA
body: Select a column in the list on the left and select the default option suggested by the system as the Format type (for example, "STRING_TYPE", "DATE_TYPE", or "NUMBER_TYPE").

title: External file column format and values match FA
body: Use the right arrow button to move the column into the list on the right.

title: External file column format and values match FA
body: The column is included in the importer. You can now select another column on the left.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: If the format and values of the column in the external file are not the same as in the FA system, you need to map the values between the external file and the FA system. For example, in the FA system, the transaction type column "type" is a string with values such as "B" (buy) and "S" (sell). If your external file uses, for example, the values "Purchase" and "Sell" for this column, you need to map them to the FA values:

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: Select a column in the list on the left and select "MAP_TYPE" as the Format type.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: Click the right arrow button to open the Map type parameter value window. Add keys and values. The type of key you select determines what values you need to define in the value field:

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: TRANSACTION_TYPE_MAPPING_EXPR. Option to map the column values in the external file to the values configured in the FA system. For example, if your external file has a transaction type column with the values "Purchase" and "Sell", map them to the FA values "B" (buy) and "S" (sell) with the equal sign and separate the values with semicolons. Example: Purchase=B; Sell=S.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: EXT_PORTFOLIO_ID_NAME. Option to map a portfolio in the external file to the portfolio in the FA system using its external ID. Portfolios can have several external IDs in FA Back (defined in Portfolio window, IDs tab), so you need to define the external portfolio ID as the value to let the FA system know which ID to look for. Example: Nordea.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: FIXED_VALUE. Option to map the external column to a fixed value, have the FA system fetch the value, or define the value with variables.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: Set a fixed value: For example, you can set the settlement date as two business days after the transaction date by defining "2" as the value for the "settlementDate" column. You can also set a constant exchange rate by defining a number as the value for the "fxRate" column (using the decimal point you defined in the basic info).

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: Have FA fetch the value: You can have the FA system fetch a value, for example the market price on the transaction date, by defining "AUTO" as the value (see File formats for importing transactions and trade orders in FA Back reference).

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: Use variables: You can define the column value with variables, for example, to modify a value before importing. Place variables inside curly brackets and field names inside square brackets. For example, you can import the absolute value for the "tradeAmount" column by defining {Math.abs([tradeAmount])} as the value. You can also use conditionals such as {'[type]'.equals('Settlement fee') ? ‘Settlement fee debt SEB' : 'AUTO'} where "Settlement fee debt SEB" is used as the transaction account if the external file transaction type is "settlement fee", and otherwise the system fetches the account.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: Click OK.

title: External file column format or values don't match FA
body: The column values are mapped to the FA system and the column is included in the importer. You can now select another column on the left.

title: Step 3 - Arrange the column list to match the external file
body: After defining the format mappings and including the columns in the list on the right, you need to make sure the list is in the same order as your external file:

title: Step 3 - Arrange the column list to match the external file
body: Use the Up and Down buttons to place the columns in the same order as in your external file.

title: Step 3 - Arrange the column list to match the external file
body: Click Save.

title: Step 3 - Arrange the column list to match the external file
body: The importer is ready to use.

title: Quickstart: Use sample reader configuration for transaction import
body: You can use our sample configuration as a basis to create your own transaction importer:

title: Quickstart: Use sample reader configuration for transaction import
body: Go to Preference → Importing → Reader format configuration.

title: Quickstart: Use sample reader configuration for transaction import
body: Click Add and then View reader as XML.

title: Quickstart: Use sample reader configuration for transaction import
body: Copy and paste the following sample importer definition into the editor and edit the values according to your needs.

title: Report data calculation
body: The FA system recalculates report data for all portfolios each night or morning to reflect the current day's portfolio positions. During the day, to ensure that report data remains up-to-date, report data recalculation is triggered when:

title: Report data calculation
body: A user adds or imports transactions.

title: Report data calculation
body: Transactions are created as the result of a corporate action, fee run, or trade order execution.

title: Report data calculation
body: Certain portfolio information is changed, for example, accounts, valuation method, benchmark, or sub-portfolio aggregation.

title: Report data calculation
body: The system recalculates data only for the portfolios that include securities or positions associated with changes. Since the system handles most of them, as a user, you don't generally need to start report data recalculations. All report data calculations are automated, so you only need to start them yourself in certain situations. To do this, use options in the Update menu at the top, described in the following sections.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Typically, report data is recalculated based on a schedule, for example, every night (see Preference - Administration in FA Back reference). The Update menu allows you to start the recalculation outside the schedule, for example, if the scheduled recalculation was unsuccessful.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate all report data of the selected group / customer / portfolio.Recalculates purchase lots and report data shown in Analytics+ and reports for the whole history of the selected portfolios.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate all report data of all portfolios. Recalculates all purchase lots and report data shown in Analytics+ and reports for the whole history of all portfolios in the system. This option prioritizes sub item recalculations over report item recalculations and first drops the report tables to not spend time on deleting individual entries from them and ensure critical FA Back functionalities are available first.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Be careful when starting a full report recalculation for all portfolios. The update can take a long time. Some functionalities become unavailable during the process.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate purchase lot and report data separately for all portfolios. Allows you to recalculate purchase lots and report data shown in Analytics+ and reports in two separate steps, so you can control what to calculate. For example, you can calculate purchase lots first to ensure critical functions of the system are available as soon as possible, and calculate report data later. You can also only calculate report data, for example, if the purchase lots are up-to-date.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate purchase lot data (sub items) for all portfolios.Recalculates purchase lots for all portfolios. Afterwards, you can use the main features of FA Back, excluding functionality relying on analytics of report data.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate report data (report items) for all portfolios.Recalculates all report data for all portfolios. After report data is updated, you can use FA Back functionalities relying on analytics or report data. Ensure that the purchase lots are up-to-date before updating report items.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Re-run the nightly report data update for all portfolios. Recalculates portfolio report data shown in Analytics+ and reports for all active portfolios starting from the last report date until the current date. If portfolio reports are already up-to-date (there are reports for the current date), no recalculation is run.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: The Update menu allows you to recalculate transaction effects. This is only required if you change the effects of a transaction type in Preference → Transactions → Transaction types but don't click Update (see Preference - Transactions in FA Back reference). For example, you can change the tax or cost effect from "adding" to "reducing", resulting in a different trade amount if taxes or costs are added instead of subtracted. After the transactions are "recalculated" (transaction trade amounts updated based on the effects change), the system recalculates the affected portfolio reports data.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: Recalculate transaction effects of selected group / customer / portfolio. Trade amounts and cash flows of transactions in selected portfolios are recalculated to take into account the changes in transaction types.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: Recalculate transaction effects of all portfolios. Trade amounts and cash flows of transactions in all portfolios are recalculated to take into account the changes in transaction types.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: Be careful when starting a full recalculation for all portfolios. The update can take a long time. Some functionalities become unavailable during the process.

title: Update market data
body: Market data connection is available in the Update menu if you receive market prices through a market data connector.

title: Update market data
body: With the Market data connection menu items, you can fetch update codes and prices for securities with the "Active" status. Fetching market prices triggers a report calculation to update the effect of the new market prices in your portfolios. The report calculation affects all portfolios containing securities that receive an updated price, and starts from the earliest market price received.

title: Update market data
body: Get missing update codes. Uploads missing update codes from the external price source and saves them in the Update code 1-3 fields in the Security window. The system uploads a missing code for securities with "Active" status that have ISIN code defined. The ISIN is needed to identify the security to update. Note that some securities (for example, currencies) don't have ISIN codes, so you need to enter the update code manually.

title: Update market data
body: Get market prices. Fetches market prices for "Active" securities with a corresponding update code (if market data connection is enabled for Update code 2 / Close 2, prices are only fetched for securities that have the Update code 2 defined).

title: Update market data
body: Get market prices for past 7/30/365 days. Fetches all prices for the past 7, 30, or 365 days and updates existing market prices. If a market price entry exists for a date, this option updates the market price only in the Close field used by the market data connector. Other Close fields keep the original values.

title: Update market data
body: Get market prices from [date]. Fetches all prices starting from the Earliest market price date configured in Preference - Administration (FA Back reference), updating existing market prices*.

title: Update market data
body: Get missing market prices. Fetches market prices for each security from the latest existing market price onward. This option allows you to fetch prices that are newer than the newest observation already stored. The system goes through all securities with a corresponding update code, determines the latest available market price date for each, and fetches new prices from that date onward. If a security doesn't have existing market prices, they are fetched starting from the earliest market price date specified in Preference → Adminstration (for details, see Preference - Administration in FA Back reference). Depending on your existing market price history, prices might be fetched for different time periods for different securities, based on their latest available observation.

title: Update market data
body: Example: A security has a price for 2.1.2019 with entries in the Manual and Close 2 fields. You fetch the market price again and include this date (using a market data connector linked to Update code 2 / Close 2). As a result, the value in Close 2 is updated. The value in Manual stays the same.

title: Revaluate securities
body: Revaluate all securities is only available in the Update menu if you have the user role that permits revaluating securities.

title: Revaluate securities
body: The Revaluate all securities menu items allow you to recalculate the discount factors for a specific time period on all your securities that have the base type "DISCOUNT" and other relevant information. The system never calculates discount factors on a security before the beginning of the position or after the maturity date, and all calculations are done until the previous day.

title: Revaluate securities
body: Revaluating securities always triggers a report calculation to update the effect of the new values in your portfolios. The report calculation affects all portfolios containing securities that receive a new valuation. For more details on the revaluation menu items, see Valuation of forward cashflows in FA Back reference.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: The Show pending and ongoing calculations menu item allows you to view pending, ongoing, and failed report calculations. You can refresh the records, export the table as an XLSX file, or delete all records. By default, calculations are deleted automatically after 30 days. The tabs Pending and ongoing and Failed show the following information:

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Scheduled

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Scheduled date and time of the report calculation.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Update since

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Date from which onwards the data is calculated. For example, if the date is a week in the future, report calculations are run from that date onwards until the completion time.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Type

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Report calculation type that distinguishes different report calculation jobs. "FULL-ALL" calculates positions and purchase lots for a portfolio's full history, "FULL" calculates positions for a portfolio's full history, "LATEST" calculates positions starting from a specific date, "SUB" only calculates purchase lots, and "REMOVE" removes report data for a portfolio.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Portfolio ID

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Unique ID of a portfolio.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: ID

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Report calculation ID.

title: User management view

The following sections describe what viewing options you have, how to manage users, how to assign user roles, how to manage user authentication, and how to manage user and account information.

title: Viewing options

title: Viewing options

title: Manage users and roles
body: You can add new users in the system and deactivate or delete existing users.

title: Add a user
body: To create a user account:

title: Add a user
body: Click Add user at the top-right corner and fill in the user information:

title: Add a user
body: The User ID used as a username at login and Email (required fields).

title: Add a user
body: Linked contact to set up access to client data or access to FA Front access with the external identity provider.

title: Add a user
body: Other fields if needed. See User details and account information for details.

title: Add a user
body: Click Edit user roles in the User details pane and choose which apps your user can access and with what roles.

title: Add a user
body: To access an app, a user needs a role for it – a user without any roles can't access any application.

title: Add a user
body: Let the user know about their credentials and how to get a password.

title: Add a user
body: Send them the user ID – FA platform doesn't send this information automatically.

title: Add a user
body: Instruct the user to request a password reset link by clicking Forgot password on the login page.

title: Deactivate a user
body: If a user doesn't need to access the platform anymore, we recommend deactivating their account rather than deleting it – this maintains the user's history while preventing them from accessing FA.

title: Deactivate a user
body: To change the status for multiple users, choose the users in the table and click . To change the status for one user, click in the User details pane. You can see the user's status in the table:

title: Deactivate a user
body: Active – The user can log in to the FA platform.

title: Deactivate a user
body: Inactive – The user can't log in to the FA platform.

title: Delete a user
body: Deleting a user removes all user information from the system. A deleted user can’t log in. If you just want to disable a user and prevent them from logging in, consider deactivating the user instead of deleting the account. To delete a user, click in the User details pane.

title: Assign user roles
body: The Roles block in the User details pane shows the roles assigned to the user. Roles determine:

title: Assign user roles
body: The app the user can access. To access an app, the user needs at least one role within that app. For example, if a user has a right in FA Back, the user is allowed to access FA Back.

title: Assign user roles
body: The access rights within the app. For example, FA Back roles determine access rights through permission and FA Front roles determine access rights through the views defined for the role.

title: Assign user roles
body: To add or remove the user’s roles, click Edit user roles at the top of the User details pane.

title: Manage authentication
body: You can manage user authentication using the following options:

title: Password reset
body: You can force the user to reset their password on next login. To force a password reset for multiple users, choose the users in the table and click . To force password reset for a selected user, click in the User details pane, choose Force password reset on next login and save the changes.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Two-factor authentication is a login option that requires entering a verification code in addition to the basic credentials (user ID and password). You can check two-factor authentication status in the User details pane:

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disabled – Two-factor authentication is turned off.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enabled – Two-factor authentication is turned on. The user has logged in and completed the mobile authenticator setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Pending – Two-factor authentication is turned on. You chose “Enable two-factor authentication on next login”, but the user didn’t yet log in to complete the setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: To manage two-factor authentication, use the buttons (available depending on the two-factor authentication status):

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication on the next login for the user.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication request that is pending.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication for the user.

title: Brute force detection
body: FA Platform uses brute force detection to identify attempts to guess a user’s password. Brute force detection temporarily disables the user's account after a certain number and frequency of login failures. The user account is disabled for one minute if:

title: Brute force detection
body: The user enters incorrect credentials twice within a second. This means that someone tries to guess the password programmatically.

title: Brute force detection
body: The user fails to enter correct credentials 5 times. After the account is disabled, every unsuccessful attempt increases the lock by one minute, up to one hour.

title: Brute force detection
body: To check if a user account is disabled by the brute force detection, open the User details pane and go to the Brute force detection section. It includes the following information:

title: Brute force detection
body: Status

title: Brute force detection
body: Brute force detection status of the user account: Blocked (deactivated by brute force detection), or Unblocked (active). A user blocked by brute force detection has to wait for up to 1 hour (depending on the number of unsuccessful login attempts) for the account to be unblocked.

title: Brute force detection
body: Total login attempts

title: Brute force detection
body: The number of failed login attempts.

title: Brute force detection
body: Last attempt

title: Brute force detection
body: The date and time of the last login attempt.

title: Brute force detection
body: IP address

title: Brute force detection
body: The IP address from which the last login attempt was made.

title: Brute force detection
body: To activate a blocked user account, choose Unblock and activate. Once unblocked, your user can log in again without waiting for the system to unblock the user after a certain time.

title: User details and account information
body: You can view or edit a user's information by clicking on them in the table (the User details sidepane opens). The following user information is available:

title: User account information
body: User ID (required)

title: User account information
body: A unique user ID for logging in to FA and log the user's activities.

title: User account information
body: Email (required)

title: User account information

title: User account information

title: User account information

title: User account information
body: The corresponding contact in FA Back. Linked contact is needed to:

title: User account information
body: Grant access only to certain customers and portfolios (see the Set up limited visibility for one user and Set up limited visibility for many users sections in the FA Admin guide).

title: User account information
body: Allow online end users to view their own investments in FA Front. A user that has a linked contact has access to the investment information associated with this contact.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact external ID

title: User account information
body: The user’s external ID received from the external identity provider when the user logs in to FA Front. External ID is used to find a matching contact for the user. If you see this field, this means that FA failed to link a contact to the user. For example, there is no contact with such an ID or there are several contacts with this ID stored in FA. In this case, you can add a contact manually in the Linked contact field.

title: User account information
body: Status

title: User account information
body: The user account status: active (the user can log in to FA) or inactive (the user can't log in to the system). See Assign user roles for details.

title: Sessions
body: The Sessions block shows a list of currently active sessions for the user. For example, the same user might have logged in with different browsers, having multiple sessions open at the same time. The list shows:

title: Sessions
body: Application

title: Sessions
body: The apps where the user is logged in within the session. For example, the user might have FA Back and FA Front open in different tabs in the same browser, accessing both applications with a single login and a single session.

title: Sessions
body: Last access

title: Sessions
body: The date and time the user accessed an app within the session. If the user accesses only one app, this shows the time they logged in, or if your user accesses multiple apps, this shows the time the user last opened a new app.

title: Sessions
body: IP address

title: Sessions
body: Shows the IP address the user is logged in from.

title: Sessions
body: You can log the user out of all sessions by clicking Log out user from all sessions. The user will be able to use FA for a short time until their authentication expires, then they will get a "communication problem" and will be taken to the login page.

title: Last logins
body: The Last logins block shows date and time of the five last user logins.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 1 c.contactId Yes Contact ID Unique ID for the contact (e.g. social security number or other unique identifier).

body: 2 c.externalId No External contact ID E.g. social security number or other additional identification.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 3 c.name Yes Name Contact name (e.g. first name and last name, company name, etc.).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 4 c.type Yes Type Define as a number: 1 = Customer 2 = Asset manager 3 = Broker 4 = Accountant 5 = Issuer 6 = Custody 7 = Lead

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 5 c.juridical Yes Juridical form Juridical form code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 6 c.status Yes Status Use the code of the status: A = Active P = Passive C = Closed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 7 c.taxCountry Yes Tax country Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 8 c.memo No Memo Text, memo information

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 9 c.classification Yes Classification Classification code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 10 c.identity Yes Identity Identity code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 11 c.address1 No Address 1

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 12 c.address2 No Address 2

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 13 c.zipCode No Zip code

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 14 c.city No City

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 15 c.country No Country

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 16 c.phone1 No Phone 1

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 17 c.phone2 No Phone 2

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 18 c.fax No Fax

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 19 c.email No Email

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 20 c.electronicCommunication No Electronic communication Define as a number: 1 = allow electronic communication 0 = not allowed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 21 c.marketingCommunication No Marketing communication Define as a number: 1 = allow marketing communication 0 = not allowed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 22 c.nationality No Nationality Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 23 c.representatives No Representatives Comma-separated list of contact IDs representing the contact, for example, 1223,1224,1225. To import tag values for a contact representative, add them after ###: Add standalone tags as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name 1>#<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Standalone1#Standalone2Add single-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name 1>#<group name>-<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission-View#Relationship type-AdvisorAdd multi-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>#<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission for trade orders:Make#Permission for trade orders:ModifyTo import multiple types of tags simultaneously, separate the tags with #. For example: 04012000###Permission-View#Employee:Finance#Employee:Accounting#Relationship type-Advisor#Standalone1#Standalone2 You can use *** syntax to add new representatives and keep existing ones (for example: ***,04012000###...). For details, see FA Invest. To add representatives to a contact without any existing representatives, add "???," at the beginning of the column's content (for example: ???,04012000####...). If the contact already has representatives, existing representatives will be kept and the new ones are not added.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 24 c.language No Language Language code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 25 c.subType No Sub type Contact sub type code (configured in the system). When a sub type is given, it will find its own parent contact type and override the given contact type's code (in column 4).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 26 c.transactionExtIdLevel No Transaction no. level Define as a number: 1 = Portfolio level 2 = Contact level

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 27 c.contactExchanges No Settlement place Comma-separated list of contact settlement places with settlement place code (configured in the system) and counter information with BIC code. Use the following syntax to import settlement place information: <settlement place code>=<counter>. E.g. APKEFIHH=ESSEFIHX,MGTCBEBE=ESSEFIHX

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 28 c.tags No Tags Comma-separated list of tags. Tags import allows you to add new tags: Standalone tags are added with a <tag name>. For example: Fund,ContractOK.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a contact already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Interests:Golf,Interests:Culture. If a contact already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Interests:Golf,---Interests:Culture. For details, see FA Invest.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 29 c.classification2 No Classification 2 Classification 2 code (configured in the system).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 30 c.classification3 No Classification 3 Classification 3 code (configured in the system).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 31 c.profileAttributes No Profile Contact-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced or removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a profile attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see FA Invest.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 32 c.extContactIdList No External IDs List of contact's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same contact exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different contact, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 33 c.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value&>&<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... E.g. AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 When importing categorized key figures (e.g. 1=Low, 2=Medium, 3=High), prior to 3.7.7 you should use the "number" (e.g. 1, 2 or 3), and after 3.7.7 you should use the "text" (e.g. Low, Medium, High). You can use *** syntax to add new observations and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:BBB=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=3. For details, see FA Invest.

body: 34 c.parent No Issuer group Contact ID of the issuer group. Available only for contacts of the Issuer type.

body: 35 c.birthDate No Date of birth Contact's birth date. Use the format yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy.MM.dd.
